evidence_chunks.text_full:
Buyer’s Corporate Standards and will enforce those policies and procedures. We shall ensure that any person associated wi th us who is 
performing activities in connection with the Contract are required to abide by terms equivalent to those agreed to by us in t his clause. 
- We shall promptly report to you any violation of the requirements set out above in relation to the Buyer’s Corporate Standard s, or any 
request by any person that we perform an act that would be a violation of those requirements. We shall provide to you, promptly and at 
no extra charge, information on and evidence of our compliance with our commitments set out hereunder as requested. We shall 
undertake independent audits, by a Competent Third Party Auditor, and accommodate site visits by your representatives , or your 
affiliates, to verify compliance with these requirements, if requested. “Competent Third Party Auditor” means a third party a uditor who 
meets the requirements of the Global Social Compliance Programme Reference Tool for Auditing Competence.  
I warrant that I have all requisite authority to sign this Tender and commit the Freight Services Provider to enter into the Contract. I confirm 
that the Freight Services Provider has complied with all the requirements of the ITT.

Name of Freight 
Services Provider: 
 
 
Signature:

evidence_chunks.text_full: Tenders must be submitted on or before the dates set out in the Tender Timetable above to be considered.
Any concerns or queries about the Tenderer’s Statement must be submitted a minimum of five working days before the ITT Round 1 Response Deadline.

Freight Services Providers Tender responses must be received by the deadline via the Transporeon platform.

24th February 2025 – 28th February 2025

Round 1 

Response analysis and qualification to Round 2

Freight Services Providers should be available for follow-up questions. Selected Freight Services Providers will get invitation to Round 2. 

03rd March 2025 – 21st March 2025

Round 2 response period

Freight Services Providers permitted to revisit their proposals via Transporeon platform

21st March 2025 (3pm CET)

ITT Round 2 response deadline 

Freight Services Providers Tender responses must be received by the deadline via the Transporeon platform.

6th March 2025 – 19th March 2025

Online & face to face meetings 

Online & face to face discussion with selected Freight Services Providers.

24th March 2025 – 4th April 2025

Round 2

Response Analysis and offers fine tuning

Freight Services Providers should be available for follow-up validation questions.

7th April 2025 – 15th April 2025

Upload of fine tunned offers  

Time  for Freight Services Providers to upload fine tunned offers in Transporeon 

16th April 2025 – 23rd May 2025

Reckitt internal alignment and allocation approval  



Week commencing 26th May 2025

Award announcement 



1st July 2025

Commencement of service   (all Regions)

Unless agreed otherwise, new Charges and allocation go into effect in accordance with clause 2.2 of the Contract 

Any changes to the Tender Timetable shall be notified to Freight Services Providers as soon as practicable. Reckitt is in its sole discretion entitled to change the deadline for the submission of Tenders at any time. 

Reckitt may accept an offer after any Round during this Tender Timetable appointing the selected Freight Services Provider for selected Routes.

sources.document: Reckitt Instructions to 2025 Quotation Tables.docx

evidence_chunks.text_full:
D - P – Scope: from Door to Port

P - P – Scope: from Port to Port

P - D – Scope: from Port to Door

[4] Origin Scope – defines scope of quotation for Origin side with the following definitions:

A – from Door, with all Origin Charges included in quoted Charges

B – from Door, with all Origin Charges included apart from Origin custom clearance

D – from Port, with all Origin Charges included apart from Origin custom clearance and pre-carriage

E – from Port, with all Origin Charges excluded 

[5] Destination Scope – defines scope of quotation for Destination side with the following definitions: 

A – to Door, with all Destination Charges included

B – to Door, with all Destination Charges included apart from Destination custom clearance

C – to Port, with all Destination Charges included apart from Destination on-carriage 

D – to Port, with all Destination Charges included, apart from Destination on-carriage and custom clearance

E – to Port, with all Destination Charges excluded

[6] Origin Plant / Supplier Name – specifies entity being a Collection Point on Origin side.

[7] Origin Country – specifies Country where the Collection Point is located.

[8] Origin Address – specifies Address, where the Collection Point is located or where the Route starts. 

[9] Destination Place Name – specifies entity being a Delivery Point on Destination side.

[10] Destination Country – specifies Country where the Delivery Point is located.

[11] Destination Market – specifies Country where the Final Destination Point is located. 

Example 1: Kenya: via Mombasa we are supplying 4 different countries: Kenya, Uganda, South Sudan and Rwanda. Destination Country will be Kenya, while Destination Market will be 4 different Countries. 

Example 2: Poland: via Poland we are supplying Poland and Ukraine. Destination Country will be Poland, while Destination Market will be 2 different Countries.

[12] Destination Address – specifies Address, where the Delivery Point is located or where the Route is cut.

[2] BU – specifies to which of Reckitt BU on given Route, the products might be addressed to, depending on product category. Reckitt Core - products for Reckitt Core BU only, Nutrition – products for Nutrition only, Essential Home - products for Essential Home BU only, RMPM (Raw and Pack materials) – Raw and Pack materials products. In regions where Essential Home and Reckitt Core BUs exist at the same time, we will maintain additional 4 BUs types: [Hygiene] Reckitt Core, [Health] Reckitt Core, [Hygiene] Essential Home, [Health] Essential Home. BU marked in “[ ]” means historical name and will be needed for financial purposes related to payment entity mainly. BU name after “[ ]” is main one that should be followed. 

[3] Route Set-up – differentiates quoted Routes depending on covered scope: 

D - D – Scope: from Door to Door

D - P – Scope: from Door to Port

P - P – Scope: from Port to Port

P - D – Scope: from Port to Door

[4] Origin Scope – defines scope of quotation for Origin side with the following definitions:

A – from Door, with all Origin Charges included in quoted Charges

B – from Door, with all Origin Charges included apart from Origin custom clearance

D – from Port, with all Origin Charges included apart from Origin custom clearance and pre-carriage

E – from Port, with all Origin Charges excluded 

[5] Destination Scope – defines scope of quotation for Destination side with the following definitions: 

A – to Door, with all Destination Charges included

B – to Door, with all Destination Charges included apart from Destination custom clearance

C – to Port, with all Destination Charges included apart from Destination on-carriage 

D – to Port, with all Destination Charges included, apart from Destination on-carriage and custom clearance

E – to Port, with all Destination Charges excluded

[6] Origin Plant / Supplier Name – specifies entity being a Collection Point on Origin side.

[7] Origin Country – specifies Country where the Collection Point is located.

Israel: Standard lane is designed to Ashdod, while we would like to explore (and potentially to use) also Haifa port which is being setup in Alternative scenario.

South Africa: Standard lane scope is to port, while we are currently in evaluation stage of having it to door for selected lanes (Alternative scenario). 

[19] Origin Service / Port Requirements – defines requirements for origin service and origin port based on which the Route needs to be quoted. 

[20] Ocean Routing Requirements – defines requirements for ocean routing based on which the Route needs to be quoted. 



[21] Ocean TT Requirements – defines requirements for ocean transit time based on which the Route needs to be quoted. 

[22] Ocean Frequency Requirements – defines requirements for ocean frequency based on which the Route needs to be quoted. 

[23] Destination Service / Port Requirements – defines requirements for destination service and destination port routing based on which the Route needs to be quoted. 

[24] Commodity – it specifies top line type of commodity shipped on each Route.

[25] Temperature Range – it specifies a range of temperature (in Celsius), under which REF containers are set up for transportation (final confirmation on required temperature for each shipment is provided by Collection Point).

[26] DG Classification – confirms Dangerous Goods product classification under which the DG shipments should be quoted.

identity.service_main_scope.answer: Freight transportation services (international freight forwarding across ocean/air/road/rail including containerised ocean shipments)

[114] BAF Classification – specifies BAF Classification as per Reckitt BAF mechanism. It’s based on container size and type, length of transport route and if headhaul or backhaul. 





S – Small

M – Medium

L – Large

X – Extra Large















Container size and type





Headhaul or backhaul



XX XXX X XXXX













Length type





Example:

20' DRY M Back – means 20 DRY medium backhaul BAF Classification.

40' / 40'HC REF X Head – means 40 REF extra large heahdhaul BAF Classification

[115] Trade – specifies tradelane for each lane. 

[116] Procurement Contact	– specifies leading buyer for each lane that is main contact point for any queries. 

As support to Quotation Table, Origin and Destination Special Requirements we used to attach to Transporeon “Opening hours for Origin Loading and Destination Unloading operations” and “FSP involvement in Customs Clearance and payment of VAT Duty”. This becomes part of Quotation Table in 2025 and you will find columns from [117] to [128] replacing 2 files mentioned above. 

GENERAL

The Freight Services Providers are free to choose the Routes for quotation, there is no requirement to quote all Routes or all Routes per Template, however, there is needed minimum scale to represent potential for allocation. 

Routes omitted for quotation should be left unfilled - empty. In case any Route is quoted the Transporeon tool will require all cells in given Route to be filled in. 

For very specific cases, where the cell is required to be left empty it should be filled in with dummy “99999” to make it identifiable while analyzing the offers.

The Freight Services Providers are required to quote following the pricing breakdown included in the quotation templates. Offers totaled without details will not be considered. Reckitt reserves the right to exclude from the scope of Services some quoted Services while allocating therefore each quoted position should reflect correctly the costs related to that Service.

All Charges quoted at zero (0) will be treated as the service offered free of any charge.

[114] BAF Classification – specifies BAF Classification as per Reckitt BAF mechanism. It’s based on container size and type, length of transport route and if headhaul or backhaul. 





S – Small

M – Medium

L – Large

X – Extra Large















Container size and type





Headhaul or backhaul



XX XXX X XXXX













Length type





Example:

20' DRY M Back – means 20 DRY medium backhaul BAF Classification.

40' / 40'HC REF X Head – means 40 REF extra large heahdhaul BAF Classification

[115] Trade – specifies tradelane for each lane. 

[116] Procurement Contact	– specifies leading buyer for each lane that is main contact point for any queries. 

As support to Quotation Table, Origin and Destination Special Requirements we used to attach to Transporeon “Opening hours for Origin Loading and Destination Unloading operations” and “FSP involvement in Customs Clearance and payment of VAT Duty”. This becomes part of Quotation Table in 2025 and you will find columns from [117] to [128] replacing 2 files mentioned above. 

GENERAL

The Freight Services Providers are free to choose the Routes for quotation, there is no requirement to quote all Routes or all Routes per Template, however, there is needed minimum scale to represent potential for allocation. 

Routes omitted for quotation should be left unfilled - empty. In case any Route is quoted the Transporeon tool will require all cells in given Route to be filled in. 

For very specific cases, where the cell is required to be left empty it should be filled in with dummy “99999” to make it identifiable while analyzing the offers.

The Freight Services Providers are required to quote following the pricing breakdown included in the quotation templates. Offers totaled without details will not be considered. Reckitt reserves the right to exclude from the scope of Services some quoted Services while allocating therefore each quoted position should reflect correctly the costs related to that Service.

All Charges quoted at zero (0) will be treated as the service offered free of any charge.

Reckitt Global Ocean Freight 2025 ITT.docx

evidence_chunks.text_full: The parties acknowledge that the following key principles are agreed and are to be observed by the parties involved, in accordance with the regulations and legislations set out in clause 1 above.

logies, plans, specifications, know-how, ideas or other business, commercial or financial information or any other information that is confidential in nature (“Confidential Information”).  Both parties undertake that, during the term of this Agreement  and after the expiry or termination of this Agreement, they and their employees shall: (a) shall keep Confidential  Information confidential; (b) shall only disclose Confidential Information to those of their employees as strictly necessary to perform their obligations under this Agreement; (c) shall not disclose Confidential Information to any third party without obtaining the prior written consent of the other party; (d) shall not use Confidential Information for any purposes other than in connection with their obligations as set out in this Agreement; and (e) at any time upon the written request of the other party, will return all Confidential Information belonging to the party making the request to that party.

	

	4.2	The obligations of confidentiality set out in paragraph 4 shall not extend to: (a) information which is now or hereafter comes into the public domain other than through the default of the party who received the information; (b) information which the a party  learns or has learned from a third party acting in good faith who has not derived the same directly or indirectly from the party who disclosed the information or its affiliates; or (c) any disclosure properly required by any governmental, supra-national or other competent court or authority in which case the party who received the information shall (where permitted to do so) promptly notify the party who disclosed the information of the facts relating to the disclosure.   

	

	Data Protection

	

	For clause 4.3 the following definitions apply: 

	"Data Protection Legislation" means any applicable legislation protecting the personal data of natural persons, including in particular the General Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council ("GDPR"), any supplementary legislation of any Member State of the European Economic Area ("Member State"

The Routes requiring coverage with a Technical Agreement should only be quoted on the grounds that the Freight Services Provider will comply with and sign a Technical Agreement (containing substantively the same obligations as those set out in the Sample Indicative Technical Agreements set out at Schedule D) within 2 weeks of the Routes and Rates Allocation Date of the Contract.

identity.contract_duration.answer: Contract takes effect on the Effective Date and continues until the 5th Routes Anniversary date (Term); cannot continue beyond the 5th Routes Anniversary date.

evidence_chunks.text_full: Subject to clause 2.3 the Contract shall take effect on the Effective Date and shall continue until the 5th Routes Anniversary date (“Term”) unless agreed otherwise by the Parties in writing. In no event shall the Contract continue beyond the 5th Routes Anniversary date.

evidence_chunks.text_full: Payment term for any Demurrage / Detention / Storage / Electricity Costs / Waiting Time Charges shall be as defined in Clause 10.4.

metadata.source: 2025 OCEAN AND AIR FREIGHT SERVICES CONTRACT.docx

evidence_chunks.text_full: Charges must be valid from 1st Jul 2025 until 30th Jun 2026 for all Routes (Container on Board Date)

sources.document: Reckitt Global Ocean Freight 2025 ITT.docx | Table_29
sources.snippet: Any concerns or queries about the Tenderer’s Statement must be submitted a minimum of five working days before the ITT Round 1 Response Deadline.

sources.document: Reckitt Global Ocean Freight 2025 ITT.docx | evaluation (Part 2/13)
sources.snippet:
24th February 2025 – 28th February 2025

Round 1

deliverables: Signed Tenderer's Statement (including name of Freight Services Provider, signature, name and status)
Evidence/information of compliance with Buyer’s Corporate Standards (including reports of any violations, and evidence as requested)
Independent audit reports by a Competent Third Party Auditor (or availability to undertake such audits)
Accommodation of site visits by Buyer representatives or affiliates to verify compliance
Contract Acceptor Contact List (Appendix 3 / completed contact list)
Documentation demonstrating maintenance of specific transportation requirements (e.g., temperature and humidity) available on request
summary.scope: Freight transportation services (international freight forwarding across ocean/air/road/rail including containerised ocean shipments)
summary.contract_type: call-off contract (Technical Agreement as part of Contract)
summary.duration: Contract takes effect on the Effective Date and continues until the 5th Routes Anniversary date (Term); cannot continue beyond the 5th Routes Anniversary date.
